Instruction: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat (around 375-400Â°F).
Peel back the husks from the corn, but leave them attached. Remove the silk.
Spread butter over each ear of corn and season with salt and black pepper.
Pull the husks back over the corn and tie them with kitchen twine to secure.
Grill the corn on the preheated grill for about 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until tender and slightly charred.
Remove from the grill, unwrap, and serve hot as a delicious side dish.
